snippet: Regarded as the least wired country in the Western Hemisphere, Cuba has expanded access in Internet salons. But the prices are beyond what most Cubans can afford.
abstract: Havana Journal; Cuba, regarded as least wired country in Western Hemisphere, has expanded its citizens' Web access by opening 118 Internet salons across country; prices, however, are beyond what most citizens can afford, prompting people to question whether Pres Raul Castro is serious about bringing Internet to masses.
lead_paragraph: Regarded as the least wired country in the Western Hemisphere, Cuba has expanded access in Internet salons. But the prices are beyond what most Cubans can afford.

headline.main: Salons or Not, Cyberspace Is Still a Distant Place for Most Cubans
headline.print_headline: Salons or Not, Cyberspace Is Still a Distant Place for Most Cubans

keywords.value: Empresa de Telecomunicaciones de Cuba SA (Etecsa)
